item.title: Proof: All Triangles Are Equilateral
item.description: \( \newcommand{\degree}{^{\circ}} \) Proof First, we are going to prove the following lemma: Lemma: Any triangle is isosceles w.r.t. arbitrary two sides (i.e. any two sides are of equal length). Proof: \( \square \) Let the triangle be \( ABC \). We’ll prove that \( AC = BC \). Here is a figure of the triangle with a few additional constructions, which we’ll define bellow: Figure of \( \triangle ABC \) Constructions: Let \( M_C \) be the midpoint of side \( AB \).
